articles.title: Guia de Pron√∫ncia do Franc√™s para Brasileiros: Sons Essenciais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

A pron√∫ncia do franc√™s √© famosa por ser desafiadora, mas como falante de portugu√™s, voc√™ tem algumas vantagens! Nosso idioma tamb√©m tem sons nasais e uma melodia pr√≥pria. Neste guia completo, vamos explorar os sons franceses mais importantes, com dicas espec√≠ficas para brasileiros.

## Som do Dia

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Je t'aime"
  translation="Eu te amo"
  pronunciation="je t√©m (n√£o 'j√™ taim√™'!)"
  context="A pron√∫ncia correta √© essencial para essa frase t√£o importante."
/>

## Os Sons Mais Desafiadores

### O "R" Franc√™s

O "R" franc√™s √© gutural, produzido na garganta. √â diferente do "R" portugu√™s.

<VocabCard
  word="Amour"
  translation="Amor"
  pronunciation="a-MUR (R gutural)"
  example="Je t'aime, mon amour."
/>

**Como praticar:**
1. Fa√ßa um som de gargarejo suave
2. N√£o use a ponta da l√≠ngua
3. O som vem da garganta/√∫vula
4. Pratique com palavras simples: "rouge" (vermelho), "rue" (rua)

<VocabCard
  word="Rouge"
  translation="Vermelho"
  pronunciation="ruj (R gutural)"
  example="J'adore cette robe rouge."
/>

### O "U" Franc√™s (diferente de "OU")

Este √© provavelmente o som mais dif√≠cil para brasileiros. O "U" franc√™s n√£o existe em portugu√™s!

<VocabCard
  word="Tu"
  translation="Voc√™"
  pronunciation="tu (l√°bios arredondados, como se fosse dizer 'i')"
  example="Tu es belle."
/>

**Como praticar:**
1. Posicione os l√°bios como se fosse dizer "u"
2. Mas pronuncie "i"
3. O resultado √© o "U" franc√™s
4. Compare: "ou" (ou, onde) vs "u" (voc√™)

<VocabCard
  word="O√π"
  translation="Onde"
  pronunciation="u (como 'u' em portugu√™s)"
  example="O√π es-tu?"
/>

<CultureTip title="U vs OU" flag="üá´üá∑">
Confundir "u" e "ou" pode mudar completamente o significado! "Dessus" (em cima) vs "dessous" (embaixo), "tu" (voc√™) vs "tout" (tudo). Pratique a diferen√ßa ouvindo m√∫sicas francesas e prestando aten√ß√£o!
</CultureTip>

## Vogais Nasais

Boa not√≠cia: o portugu√™s tamb√©m tem vogais nasais, ent√£o voc√™ tem vantagem!

### O Som "AN/EN" [√£]

<VocabCard
  word="Amant"
  translation="Amante"
  pronunciation="a-M√ÉN"
  example="Tu es mon seul amant."
/>

Similar ao "√£" de "p√£o" ou "m√£e" em portugu√™s.

### O Som "ON" [√µ]

<VocabCard
  word="Mon"
  translation="Meu"
  pronunciation="m√µn (nasal)"
  example="Mon amour, mon c≈ìur."
/>

Similar ao "om" de "som" em portugu√™s, mas mais nasal.

### O Som "IN/AIN/EIN" […õÃÉ]

<VocabCard
  word="Vin"
  translation="Vinho"
  pronunciation="v…õÃÉn"
  example="Un verre de vin, s'il vous pla√Æt."
/>

N√£o existe exatamente em portugu√™s. √â como um "√£" mais fechado, quase como "√™" nasal.

### O Som "UN" [≈ìÃÉ]

<VocabCard
  word="Un"
  translation="Um"
  pronunciation="≈ìÃÉn"
  example="Un caf√©, s'il vous pla√Æt."
/>

Tamb√©m n√£o existe em portugu√™s. √â como um "√¥" nasal arredondado.

## As Famosas "Liaisons"

Em franc√™s, as palavras se conectam de formas espec√≠ficas.

<VocabCard
  word="Je t'aime"
  translation="Eu te amo"
  pronunciation="je-t√©m (tudo junto)"
  example="Je t'aime plus que tout."
/>

**Exemplos de liaison:**
- "Les amis" ‚Üí "l√©-za-MI" (o "s" se conecta com o "a")
- "Nous avons" ‚Üí "nu-za-V√ïN"
- "Un homme" ‚Üí "≈ìÃÉ-NOM"

<CultureTip title="Quando N√ÉO Fazer Liaison" flag="üá´üá∑">
A liaison n√£o acontece sempre. Geralmente n√£o ocorre antes de palavras que come√ßam com "h aspir√©" (h aspirado) ou ap√≥s a palavra "et" (e). Por exemplo: "et il" se pronuncia "√© il", n√£o "√©-til".
</CultureTip>

## Sons que N√£o Existem em Portugu√™s

### O Som "EU" [√∏/≈ì]

<VocabCard
  word="Deux"
  translation="Dois"
  pronunciation="d√∂ (l√°bios arredondados)"
  example="Nous deux, pour toujours."
/>

**Como praticar:**
1. Diga "√™" (como em "voc√™")
2. Arredonde os l√°bios como se fosse dizer "o"
3. Mantenha a l√≠ngua na posi√ß√£o de "√™"

<VocabCard
  word="C≈ìur"
  translation="Cora√ß√£o"
  pronunciation="k√∂r"
  example="Mon c≈ìur t'appartient."
/>

### O Som "OI" [wa]

<VocabCard
  word="Toi"
  translation="Voc√™ (objeto)"
  pronunciation="tua"
  example="Je pense √† toi."
/>

Este √© mais f√°cil! "OI" em franc√™s soa como "ua".
- "Moi" ‚Üí "mua"
- "Toi" ‚Üí "tua"
- "Soir" ‚Üí "suar"

## Letras Mudas

O franc√™s tem muitas letras que n√£o se pronunciam!

### Consoantes Finais (geralmente mudas)

<VocabCard
  word="Beaucoup"
  translation="Muito"
  pronunciation="bo-KU (p mudo)"
  example="Je t'aime beaucoup."
/>

**Regra geral:** As consoantes finais S, T, D, P, X, Z geralmente s√£o mudas.

| Escrita | Pron√∫ncia | Significado |
|---------|-----------|-------------|
| Parfait | par-F√â | Perfeito |
| Temps | t√£ | Tempo |
| Grand | gr√£ | Grande |
| Trop | tro | Demais |
| Heureux | √∂-R√ñ | Feliz |
| Chez | sh√© | Na casa de |

### O "E" Final (geralmente mudo)

<VocabCard
  word="Belle"
  translation="Linda"
  pronunciation="b√©l (e final mudo)"
  example="Tu es si belle."
/>

Na maioria das vezes, o "e" no final das palavras n√£o √© pronunciado.

<CultureTip title="CaReFuL - Exce√ß√µes" flag="üá´üá∑">
Existe uma regra chamada "CaReFuL" para lembrar quais consoantes finais S√ÉO pronunciadas: C, R, F, L. Exemplos: "sac" (sak), "amour" (a-MUR), "chef" (sh√©f), "seul" (s√∂l). Mas aten√ß√£o, h√° exce√ß√µes!
</CultureTip>

## Tabela de Sons Essenciais

| Grafema | Som | Exemplo | Pron√∫ncia |
|---------|-----|---------|-----------|
| AI | √© | Aimer | √©-M√â |
| AU/EAU | o | Beau | bo |
| EU | √∂ | Deux | d√∂ |
| OI | ua | Toi | tua |
| OU | u | Amour | a-MUR |
| U | √º | Tu | t√º |
| AN/EN | √£ | Amant | a-M√É |
| ON | √µ | Mon | m√µ |
| IN | …õÃÉ | Vin | v…õÃÉ |
| GN | nh | Magnifique | ma-nhi-FIK |
| CH | sh | Ch√©ri | sh√©-RI |
| J | j | Je | je |

## Palavras Rom√¢nticas para Praticar

Pratique estes sons com vocabul√°rio rom√¢ntico:

<VocabCard
  word="Amoureux"
  translation="Apaixonado"
  pronunciation="a-mu-R√ñ"
  example="Je suis tellement amoureux de toi."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Magnifique"
  translation="Magn√≠fico"
  pronunciation="ma-nhi-FIK"
  example="Tu es magnifique ce soir."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Toujours"
  translation="Sempre"
  pronunciation="tu-JUR"
  example="Je t'aimerai toujours."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ensemble"
  translation="Juntos"
  pronunciation="√£-S√ÉBL"
  example="Ensemble pour la vie."
/>

## Erros Comuns de Brasileiros

| Erro | Correto | Dica |
|------|---------|------|
| Pronunciar todos os "e" finais | E final geralmente mudo | "Belle" = "b√©l", n√£o "b√©le" |
| "R" como em portugu√™s | R gutural | Pratique o gargarejo |
| "U" como "u" portugu√™s | U franc√™s (l√°bios + i) | "Tu" ‚â† "tu" |
| N√£o fazer liaisons | Conectar palavras | "Les amis" = "l√©-za-MI" |
| Pronunciar "gn" como "gn" | "gn" = "nh" | "Magnifique" tem "nh" |

## Exerc√≠cios de Pron√∫ncia

### Exerc√≠cio 1: Vogais Nasais
Repita: "Mon vin blanc" (meu vinho branco) - m√µ v…õÃÉ bl√£

### Exerc√≠cio 2: U vs OU
Alterne: "Tu" (voc√™) / "Tout" (tudo) - t√º / tu

### Exerc√≠cio 3: R Franc√™s
Pratique: "Rue rouge" (rua vermelha) - r√º ruj

### Exerc√≠cio 4: Frases Rom√¢nticas
Diga em voz alta:
- "Je t'aime de tout mon c≈ìur" (je t√©m de tu m√µ k√∂r)
- "Tu es l'amour de ma vie" (tu √© la-MUR de ma vi)
- "Mon c≈ìur t'appartient" (m√µ k√∂r ta-par-TI√ÉN)


## Dicas Finais para Brasileiros

1. **Ou√ßa muito** - M√∫sicas, filmes, podcasts franceses
2. **Grave-se** - Compare sua pron√∫ncia com nativos
3. **Pratique com seu parceiro** - Corrijam-se mutuamente
4. **Foque nos sons diferentes** - U, EU, R gutural
5. **N√£o traduza** - Pense em franc√™s, n√£o em portugu√™s traduzido
6. **Seja paciente** - A pron√∫ncia leva tempo para aperfei√ßoar

<CTA
  text="Quer praticar pron√∫ncia francesa com seu parceiro?"
  buttonText="Come√ßar a Aprender Juntos"
/>

sections: ## Sons que N√£o Existem em Portugu√™s

articles.title: Vocabulaire Courses en Polonais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Faire les courses ensemble est l'une des fa√ßons les plus pratiques et romantiques de pratiquer le polonais avec votre partenaire. Que vous planifiez un d√Æner douillet √† la maison ou que vous fassiez le plein de provisions, conna√Ætre le bon vocabulaire rendra votre exp√©rience de **zakupy** (courses) fluide et agr√©able.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Idziemy na zakupy"
  translation="Allons faire les courses"
  pronunciation="[I-dj√©-mi na za-KOU-pi]"
  context="La phrase parfaite pour commencer votre aventure shopping ensemble."
/>

## Types de magasins en Pologne

La Pologne offre un merveilleux m√©lange de boutiques traditionnelles et de supermarch√©s modernes. Voici o√π vous ferez vos courses :

| Magasin polonais | Fran√ßais | Ce que vous y trouverez |
|---|---|---|
| **Sklep spo≈ºywczy** | √âpicerie | Produits alimentaires de base |
| **Supermarket** | Supermarch√© | Tout sous un m√™me toit |
| **Piekarnia** | Boulangerie | Pain frais et viennoiseries |
| **Masarnia** | Boucherie | Viande fra√Æche |
| **Warzywniak** | Primeur | Fruits et l√©gumes frais |
| **Apteka** | Pharmacie | M√©dicaments et produits de sant√© |
| **Drogeria** | Droguerie | Cosm√©tiques et produits de toilette |

<VocabCard
  word="Sklep spo≈ºywczy"
  translation="√âpicerie"
  pronunciation="[skl√®p spo-JIF-tchi]"
  example="Musimy i≈õƒá do sklepu spo≈ºywczego po mleko."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Heures d'ouverture">
La plupart des magasins polonais sont ferm√©s le dimanche, sauf les petites √©piceries **≈ªabka** (un √©quivalent des sup√©rettes). Planifiez vos courses en semaine ou le samedi pour √©viter les mauvaises surprises ! C'est diff√©rent de la France o√π de plus en plus de magasins ouvrent le dimanche.
</CultureTip>

## Verbes essentiels pour les courses

Ces verbes vous aideront √† naviguer dans n'importe quelle situation de courses :

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Kupowaƒá"
  meaning="acheter"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Je", word: "kupujƒô", translation: "j'ach√®te" },
    { person: "Tu (informel)", word: "kupujesz", translation: "tu ach√®tes" },
    { person: "Il/Elle", word: "kupuje", translation: "il/elle ach√®te" },
    { person: "Nous", word: "kupujemy", translation: "nous achetons" },
    { person: "Vous (pluriel)", word: "kupujecie", translation: "vous achetez" },
    { person: "Ils/Elles", word: "kupujƒÖ", translation: "ils/elles ach√®tent" }
  ]}
/>

Autres verbes utiles pour les courses :
- **Szukaƒá** (CHOU-katch) - chercher
- **Potrzebowaƒá** (po-tch√©-BO-vatch) - avoir besoin de
- **P≈Çaciƒá** (POUA-tchitch) - payer
- **Wybieraƒá** (vi-BI√â-ratch) - choisir

## Cat√©gories et produits alimentaires

### Produits laitiers - **Nabia≈Ç** (na-BIAOU)

- **Mleko** (ML√â-ko) - lait
- **Ser** (s√®r) - fromage
- **Mas≈Ço** (MA-souo) - beurre
- **Jogurt** (IO-gourt) - yaourt
- **≈ömietana** (chmi√©-TA-na) - cr√®me fra√Æche
- **Twar√≥g** (TSFA-rouk) - fromage blanc (un incontournable polonais !)

<VocabCard
  word="Twar√≥g"
  translation="Fromage blanc (type polonais)"
  pronunciation="[TSFA-rouk]"
  example="Twar√≥g jest bardzo popularny w Polsce."
/>

### Viande - **Miƒôso** (MI√àN-so)

- **Kurczak** (KOUR-tchak) - poulet
- **Wo≈Çowina** (vo-ouo-VI-na) - b≈ìuf
- **Wieprzowina** (vi√®-pcho-VI-na) - porc
- **Kie≈Çbasa** (ki√©ou-BA-sa) - saucisse
- **Szynka** (CHIN-ka) - jambon

### Fruits - **Owoce** (o-VO-ts√©)

- **Jab≈Çko** (IAB-ouko) - pomme
- **Banan** (BA-nan) - banane
- **Pomara≈Ñcza** (po-ma-RAN-tcha) - orange
- **Truskawka** (trous-KAF-ka) - fraise
- **Gruszka** (GROUCH-ka) - poire

### L√©gumes - **Warzywa** (va-JI-va)

- **Ziemniak** (JI√àM-niak) - pomme de terre
- **Marchew** (MAR-rh√®f) - carotte
- **Cebula** (ts√©-BOU-la) - oignon
- **Pomidor** (po-MI-dor) - tomate
- **Og√≥rek** (o-GOU-r√®k) - concombre
- **Kapusta** (ka-POUS-ta) - chou

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Produits polonais">
La Pologne est c√©l√®bre pour ses d√©licieux **og√≥rki kwa≈õne** (cornichons √† l'aigre) et sa **kapusta kiszona** (choucroute). Ne partez pas sans les avoir go√ªt√©s ! Les Fran√ßais appr√©cieront ces saveurs qui rappellent un peu l'Alsace.
</CultureTip>

## Phrases essentielles pour les courses

### Pour commencer
- **Gdzie jest...?** (gdj√© i√©sst) - O√π est... ?
- **Szukam...** (CHOU-kam) - Je cherche...
- **Potrzebujƒô...** (po-tch√©-BOU-i√©) - J'ai besoin de...
- **Mamy listƒô zakup√≥w** (MA-mi LIS-t√© za-KOU-pouf) - Nous avons une liste de courses

### Au comptoir
- **Ile to kosztuje?** (I-l√© to koch-TOU-i√©) - Combien √ßa co√ªte ?
- **Poproszƒô kilogram** (po-PRO-ch√© KI-lo-gram) - Un kilogramme, s'il vous pla√Æt
- **Czy mo≈ºna spr√≥bowaƒá?** (tchi MOJ-na SPROU-bo-vatch) - Puis-je go√ªter ?
- **To wszystko** (to FCHIST-ko) - C'est tout

### Au moment de payer
- **P≈Çacƒô kartƒÖ** (POUA-ts√© KAR-tong) - Je paye par carte
- **P≈Çacƒô got√≥wkƒÖ** (POUA-ts√© go-TOUF-kong) - Je paye en esp√®ces
- **Proszƒô paragon** (PRO-ch√© pa-RA-gon) - Le ticket de caisse, s'il vous pla√Æt

<VocabCard
  word="Paragon"
  translation="Ticket de caisse"
  pronunciation="[pa-RA-gon]"
  example="Zawsze biorƒô paragon po zakupach."
/>

## Quantit√©s et mesures

Comprendre les mesures polonaises est crucial pour les courses :

- **Kilogram** (KI-lo-gram) - kilogramme
- **Gram** (gram) - gramme
- **Litr** (litr) - litre
- **Sztuka** (CHTOU-ka) - pi√®ce/unit√©
- **P√≥≈Ç kilo** (pouou KI-lo) - un demi-kilo
- **ƒÜwierƒá** (tchvi√©rtch) - un quart

## Phrases romantiques pour les courses

Rendez vos courses sp√©ciales avec ces phrases douces :

- **Co chcesz ugotowaƒá dla mnie?** (tso RHTS√©ch ou-go-TO-vatch dla mni√©) - Que veux-tu cuisiner pour moi ?
- **Kupmy co≈õ s≈Çodkiego** (KOUP-mi tso-ch SOUOD-ki√©-go) - Achetons quelque chose de sucr√©
- **Ty wybieraj, ja p≈Çacƒô** (ti vi-BI√â-rai ia POUA-ts√©) - Tu choisis, je paye
- **Razem robimy najlepsze zakupy** (RA-z√®m ro-BI-mi nai-L√àP-ch√© za-KOU-pi) - Ensemble nous faisons les meilleures courses

## D√©fis courants lors des courses

### Quand vous ne trouvez pas quelque chose
- **Przepraszam, gdzie mogƒô znale≈∫ƒá...?** (pch√©-PRA-cham gdj√© MO-gu√© ZNA-l√©jdj) - Pardon, o√π puis-je trouver... ?
- **Czy macie...?** (tchi MA-tch√©) - Avez-vous... ?
- **Nie ma na p√≥≈Çce** (ni√© ma na POUOU-ts√©) - Ce n'est pas sur l'√©tag√®re

### Quand c'est trop cher
- **To za drogie** (to za DRO-gui√©) - C'est trop cher
- **Czy jest co≈õ ta≈Ñszego?** (tchi i√©sst tso-ch TAN-ch√©-go) - Y a-t-il quelque chose de moins cher ?
- **Szukamy czego≈õ w promocji** (CHOU-ka-mi TCH√â-go-ch f pro-MO-tsii) - Nous cherchons quelque chose en promotion

> Conseil de pro : Les supermarch√©s polonais ont souvent des **promocje** (promotions) signal√©es par des √©tiquettes jaunes vives. Cherchez les offres **2+1 gratis** (achetez 2, obtenez 1 gratuit) !

## √âtiquette des courses polonaises

- Dites toujours **dzie≈Ñ dobry** (dji√®n DO-bri) en entrant dans les petites boutiques
- Faites la queue poliment et attendez votre tour
- Apportez vos propres sacs - les sacs plastiques sont payants
- Ne touchez pas les produits √† moins de les acheter
- **Dziƒôkujƒô** (DJIN-kou-i√©) et **do widzenia** (do vi-DZ√â-nia) en partant

## Faire une liste de courses ensemble

Cr√©ez votre **lista zakup√≥w** (liste de courses) avec ces phrases :

- **Co nam siƒô ko≈Ñczy?** (tso nam ch√© KON-tchi) - Qu'est-ce qui nous manque ?
- **Dodaj to do listy** (DO-dai to do LIS-ti) - Ajoute √ßa √† la liste
- **Sprawd≈∫my lod√≥wkƒô** (SPRAF-djmi lo-DOUF-k√©) - V√©rifions le frigo
- **Nie zapominaj o...** (ni√© za-po-MI-nai o) - N'oublie pas...

Faire les courses ensemble en Pologne, c'est bien plus qu'acheter des provisions - c'est exp√©rimenter la culture polonaise, pratiquer la langue et cr√©er des souvenirs avec votre partenaire. Chaque visite au **sklep** (magasin) devient une opportunit√© d'apprendre quelque chose de nouveau et de vous rapprocher l'un de l'autre.


<CTA text="Pr√™ts √† pratiquer le vocabulaire des courses en polonais avec votre partenaire ?" buttonText="Commencer √† apprendre ensemble" />

articles.title: Portugalskie powitania i po≈ºegnania dla par
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Portugalskie powitania sƒÖ ciep≈Çe i przyjazne! Od prostego "Ol√°!" po czu≈Çe "Meu amor" - oto kompletny przewodnik.

## Podstawowe powitania

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ol√°!"
  translation="Cze≈õƒá!"
  pronunciation="o-la"
  context="Najpopularniejsze portugalskie powitanie"
/>

### Powitania wed≈Çug pory dnia

<VocabCard
  word="Bom dia!"
  translation="Dzie≈Ñ dobry!"
  pronunciation="bom dzia"
  example="Bom dia! Como est√°?"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Kiedy u≈ºywaƒá | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------------|--------|
| **Bom dia** | bom dzia | Do ~12:00 | Dzie≈Ñ dobry |
| **Boa tarde** | bo-a tar-de | 12:00-18:00 | Dzie≈Ñ dobry (popo≈Çudnie) |
| **Boa noite** | bo-a noj-te | Po 18:00 | Dobry wiecz√≥r / Dobranoc |

<CultureTip title="Boa noite - dwa znaczenia" flag="üáµüáπ">
"Boa noite" mo≈ºe byƒá zar√≥wno powitaniem (dobry wiecz√≥r) jak i po≈ºegnaniem (dobranoc)! Kontekst decyduje o znaczeniu.
</CultureTip>

### Nieformalne powitania

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski | Region |
|-------------|--------|--------|--------|
| **Ol√°!** | o-la | Cze≈õƒá! | Uniwersalne |
| **Oi!** | oj | Hej! | Brazylia |
| **E a√≠?** | i a-i | Co tam? | Brazylia (slang) |
| **Tudo bem?** | tu-du bem | Wszystko ok? | Uniwersalne |
| **Tudo bom?** | tu-du bom | Wszystko dobrze? | Brazylia |

## "Jak siƒô masz?"

<VocabCard
  word="Como est√°s?"
  translation="Jak siƒô masz?"
  pronunciation="ko-mu esz-tasz"
  example="Ol√°! Como est√°s? - Bem, obrigado!"
/>

### Sposoby pytania

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Formalno≈õƒá |
|-------------|--------|------------|
| **Como est√°s?** | ko-mu esz-tasz | Nieformalne (tu) |
| **Como est√°?** | ko-mu esz-ta | Formalne (voc√™) |
| **Como vai?** | ko-mu waj | Neutralne |
| **Tudo bem?** | tu-du bem | Nieformalne |
| **Tudo certo?** | tu-du ser-tu | Nieformalne |

### Typowe odpowiedzi

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Bem, obrigado/a** | bem, o-bri-ga-du | Dobrze, dziƒôkujƒô |
| **Muito bem** | mui-tu bem | Bardzo dobrze |
| **√ìtimo!** | o-ti-mu | ≈öwietnie! |
| **Tudo bem** | tu-du bem | Wszystko dobrze |
| **Mais ou menos** | maisz ou me-nusz | Tak sobie |
| **Assim assim** | a-sim a-sim | Tak sobie |

<CultureTip title="Tudo bem?" flag="üáßüá∑">
W Brazylii "Tudo bem?" to i pytanie, i odpowied≈∫! "Tudo bem?" - "Tudo bem!" Prosty, ciep≈Çy wymiana zda≈Ñ przy powitaniu.
</CultureTip>

## Powitania dla par

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Bom dia, meu amor!"
  translation="Dzie≈Ñ dobry, moja mi≈Ço≈õci!"
  pronunciation="bom dzia, meu a-mor"
  context="Romantyczne poranne powitanie"
/>

### Poranne

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Bom dia, querido/a** | bom dzia, ke-ri-du | Dzie≈Ñ dobry, drogi/a |
| **Dormiste bem?** | dor-misz-te bem | Dobrze spa≈Çe≈õ/a≈õ? |
| **Sonhei contigo** | so-niei kon-ti-gu | ≈öni≈Çem/am o tobie |
| **Bom dia, minha vida** | bom dzia, mi-nia wi-da | Dzie≈Ñ dobry, moje ≈ºycie |

### Gdy wracasz do domu

<VocabCard
  word="Cheguei, amor!"
  translation="Jestem, kochanie!"
  pronunciation="sze-gej, a-mor"
  example="Cheguei! Tiveste saudades?"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Estou em casa!** | esz-tou em ka-za | Jestem w domu! |
| **Tiveste saudades?** | ti-wesz-te sau-da-desz | Tƒôskni≈Çe≈õ/a≈õ? |
| **Tive saudades tuas** | ti-we sau-da-desz tu-asz | Tƒôskni≈Çem/am za tobƒÖ |
| **Como foi o teu dia?** | ko-mu foj u teu dzia | Jak minƒÖ≈Ç dzie≈Ñ? |

## Po≈ºegnania podstawowe

<VocabCard
  word="Adeus"
  translation="Do widzenia"
  pronunciation="a-deusz"
  example="Adeus! At√© breve!"
/>

### Formalne

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Adeus** | a-deusz | Do widzenia |
| **At√© logo** | a-te lo-gu | Do zobaczenia |
| **Tenha um bom dia** | te-nia um bom dzia | Mi≈Çego dnia |
| **Bom fim de semana** | bom fim de se-ma-na | Mi≈Çego weekendu |
| **At√© breve** | a-te bre-we | Do rych≈Çego zobaczenia |

### Nieformalne

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski | Region |
|-------------|--------|--------|--------|
| **Tchau!** | czau | Pa! | Uniwersalne |
| **At√© mais!** | a-te maisz | Na razie! | Uniwersalne |
| **At√© depois!** | a-te de-pojsz | Do p√≥≈∫niej! | Uniwersalne |
| **Falou!** | fa-lou | Nara! | Brazylia (slang) |
| **Fui!** | fuj | Lecƒô! | Brazylia (slang) |

<CultureTip title="Tchau" flag="üáßüá∑">
"Tchau" pochodzi od w≈Çoskiego "ciao" i jest najpopularniejszym nieformalnym po≈ºegnaniem - zar√≥wno w Portugalii jak i w Brazylii!
</CultureTip>

## Po≈ºegnania dla par

<PhraseOfDay
  word="At√© logo, meu amor, amo-te!"
  translation="Do zobaczenia, kochanie, kocham ciƒô!"
  pronunciation="a-te lo-gu, meu a-mor, a-mu-te"
  context="Codzie≈Ñne po≈ºegnanie"
/>

### Na ca≈Çy dzie≈Ñ

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Tem um bom dia, amor** | tem um bom dzia, a-mor | Mi≈Çego dnia, kochanie |
| **At√© logo** | a-te lo-gu | Do zobaczenia |
| **Vou pensar em ti** | wou pen-sar em ti | Bƒôdƒô o tobie my≈õleƒá |
| **Escreve-me** | esz-kre-we-me | Napisz do mnie |
| **Amo-te, tchau!** | a-mu-te, czau | Kocham, pa! |

### Na dobranoc

<VocabCard
  word="Boa noite, dorme bem, bons sonhos"
  translation="Dobranoc, ≈õpij dobrze, s≈Çodkich sn√≥w"
  pronunciation="bo-a noj-te, dor-me bem, bos≈º so-niusz"
  example="Amo-te. Boa noite, dorme bem, bons sonhos."
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Boa noite** | bo-a noj-te | Dobranoc |
| **Dorme bem** | dor-me bem | ≈öpij dobrze |
| **Bons sonhos** | bos≈º so-niusz | S≈Çodkich sn√≥w |
| **At√© amanh√£** | a-te a-ma-nia≈Ç | Do jutra |
| **Sonha comigo** | so-nia ko-mi-gu | ≈önij o mnie |

## Specjalne okazje

### Przed podr√≥≈ºƒÖ

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Boa viagem!** | bo-a wia-≈ºem | Szczƒô≈õliwej podr√≥≈ºy! |
| **Vai com cuidado** | waj kom kui-da-du | Jed≈∫ ostro≈ºnie |
| **Liga-me quando chegares** | li-ga-me kwan-du sze-ga-resz | Zadzwo≈Ñ jak dojedziesz |

### Przed wa≈ºnym wydarzeniem

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Boa sorte!** | bo-a sor-te | Powodzenia! |
| **Vai correr bem!** | waj ko-rer bem | P√≥jdzie dobrze! |
| **Tu consegues!** | tu kon-se-gesz | Dasz radƒô! |
| **Estou a torcer por ti** | esz-tou a tor-ser por ti | Trzymam za ciebie kciuki |

<CultureTip title="Duas beijinhos" flag="üáµüáπ">
W Portugalii przy powitaniu i po≈ºegnaniu daje siƒô dwa poca≈Çunki w policzki - jeden na ka≈ºdy policzek! W Brazylii - zazwyczaj te≈º dwa, ale regionalne r√≥≈ºnice istniejƒÖ.
</CultureTip>

## ƒÜwiczenia dla par

### ƒÜwiczenie 1: Poranna rutyna
Przez tydzie≈Ñ witajcie siƒô rano po portugalsku:
- "Bom dia, amor!"
- "Dormiste bem?"
- "At√© logo!"

### ƒÜwiczenie 2: SMS-y
Wysy≈Çajcie sobie wiadomo≈õci:
- "Saudades!" (Tƒôskniƒô!)
- "At√© logo, meu amor!"

### ƒÜwiczenie 3: Wieczorna rutyna
- "Cheguei!"
- "Boa noite, bons sonhos"

## Podsumowanie

Portugalskie powitania sƒÖ ciep≈Çe i melodyjne! Pamiƒôtaj: "Bom dia/Boa tarde/Boa noite" w zale≈ºno≈õci od pory dnia. Miƒôdzy sobƒÖ u≈ºywajcie czu≈Çych "meu amor", "querido/a", "minha vida"!

## Kontynuuj naukƒô

- **[Niezbƒôdne zwroty dla par](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Wiƒôcej zwrot√≥w
- **[Portugalskie zdrobnienia](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-pet-names-terms-of-endearment/)** - S≈Çodkie zwroty
- **[Wymowa portugalska](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-pronunciation-guide/)** - M√≥w pewnie
- **[S≈Çownictwo na randkƒô](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-date-night-vocabulary/)** - Romantyczne zwroty

<CTA text="Gotowi powitaƒá portugalski?" buttonText="Zacznij teraz" />

articles.title: Ingilizce Dilbilgisi Temelleri: Ciftler Icin Rehber
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Ingilizce dilbilgisi, Turkce'den oldukca farkli bir yapiya sahiptir. Ancak temel kurallari anladiginizda, Ingilizce cok daha mantikli hale gelir. Bu rehberde, partnerinizle birlikte ogrenebileceginiz temel dilbilgisi konularini bulacaksiniz.

## Cumle Yapisi: Ozne-Fiil-Nesne

Ingilizce'de sabit bir kelime sirasi vardir: **Ozne + Fiil + Nesne (SVO)**

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I love you"
  translation="Seni seviyorum"
  pronunciation="ay lav yu"
  context="Ozne (I) + Fiil (love) + Nesne (you)"
/>

| Turkce | Ingilizce | Yapi |
|--------|-----------|------|
| Seni seviyorum | I love you | SVO |
| O kitap okuyor | She reads books | SVO |
| Biz film izliyoruz | We watch movies | SVO |

<CultureTip title="Kelime Sirasi" flag="üá¨üáß">
Turkce'de kelime sirasi esnek olabilir cunku ekler anlami belirler. Ingilizce'de kelime sirasi sabittir - "I love you" ve "You love I" tamamen farkli anlamlara gelir (ikincisi yanlis!).
</CultureTip>

## Zamanlar (Tenses)

### Simdiki Zaman (Present Simple)

Gunluk rutinler, genel gercekler ve duygular icin:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="love"
  meaning="sevmek"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "I", word: "love", translation: "seviyorum" },
    { person: "you", word: "love", translation: "seviyorsun" },
    { person: "he/she/it", word: "loves", translation: "seviyor" },
    { person: "we", word: "love", translation: "seviyoruz" },
    { person: "they", word: "love", translation: "seviyorlar" }
  ]}
/>

**Kural**: He/she/it icin fiile **-s** eklenir.

### Simdiki Surekli Zaman (Present Continuous)

Su anda olan eylemler icin:

| Turkce | Ingilizce |
|--------|-----------|
| Yemek yiyorum | I am eating |
| O uyuyor | She is sleeping |
| Onlar konusuyor | They are talking |

**Yapi**: Ozne + am/is/are + fiil-ing

<VocabCard
  word="I am thinking about you"
  translation="Seni dusunuyorum"
  pronunciation="ay em tin-king e-baut yu"
  example="What are you thinking about? - I am thinking about you."
/>

### Gecmis Zaman (Past Simple)

Gecmiste tamamlanmis eylemler icin:

| Turkce | Ingilizce |
|--------|-----------|
| Seni gordum | I saw you |
| O geldi | He came |
| Biz gittik | We went |

**Duzensiz fiiller** cok onemlidir:

| Mastar | Gecmis | Turkce |
|--------|--------|--------|
| go | went | gitmek |
| see | saw | gormek |
| come | came | gelmek |
| have | had | sahip olmak |
| say | said | soylemek |

### Gelecek Zaman (Future Simple)

Gelecekteki eylemler icin **will** kullanilir:

<VocabCard
  word="I will always love you"
  translation="Seni her zaman seveceƒüim"
  pronunciation="ay vil ol-veyz lav yu"
  example="No matter what happens, I will always love you."
/>

## Zamirier (Pronouns)

### Kisisel Zamirler

| Ozne | Nesne | Iyelik (sifat) | Iyelik (zamir) |
|------|-------|----------------|----------------|
| I | me | my | mine |
| you | you | your | yours |
| he | him | his | his |
| she | her | her | hers |
| it | it | its | its |
| we | us | our | ours |
| they | them | their | theirs |

**Ornekler**:
- **I** love **you** ‚Üí Ben seni seviyorum
- **She** loves **him** ‚Üí O onu seviyor
- This is **my** book ‚Üí Bu benim kitabim
- This book is **mine** ‚Üí Bu kitap benimdir

## Soru Yapisi

Ingilizce'de soru yapmak icin yardimci fiil basna gecer:

### Do/Does ile Sorular

| Olumlu | Soru |
|--------|------|
| You love me | Do you love me? |
| She speaks English | Does she speak English? |

### Be Fiili ile Sorular

| Olumlu | Soru |
|--------|------|
| You are happy | Are you happy? |
| She is coming | Is she coming? |

### Soru Kelimeleri

| Ingilizce | Turkce | Ornek |
|-----------|--------|-------|
| What | Ne | What do you want? |
| Where | Nerede | Where are you? |
| When | Ne zaman | When will you come? |
| Why | Neden | Why do you love me? |
| How | Nasil | How are you? |
| Who | Kim | Who is that? |

<VocabCard
  word="What are you thinking about?"
  translation="Ne dusunuyorsun?"
  pronunciation="vat ar yu tin-king e-baut"
  example="You look distracted. What are you thinking about?"
/>

## Olumsuz Yapisi

**Do/does + not** veya **don't/doesn't**:

| Olumlu | Olumsuz |
|--------|---------|
| I love | I don't love |
| She speaks | She doesn't speak |
| We are happy | We aren't happy |

<CultureTip title="Cift Olumsuz Yok" flag="üá¨üáß">
Turkce'de "Hic bir sey bilmiyorum" diyebilirsiniz (cift olumsuz). Ingilizce'de bu yanlistir: "I don't know nothing" yerine "I don't know anything" olmali.
</CultureTip>

## Tanim Edatlari (Articles)

Turkce'de tanim edati yoktur, bu yuzden bu konu zor olabilir:

### "A/An" - Belirsiz

- Tekil, belirsiz nesneler icin
- Unsuz harflerden once **a**: a book, a car
- Unlu seslerden once **an**: an apple, an hour

### "The" - Belirli

- Bilinen veya daha once bahsedilen nesneler icin
- I saw **a** dog. **The** dog was big. (Bir kopek gordum. Kopek buyuktu.)

<VocabCard
  word="You are the love of my life"
  translation="Sen hayatimin askisin"
  pronunciation="yu ar de lav ov may layf"
  example="The ile 'belirli' ask - yani sadece sen!"
/>

## Edatlar (Prepositions)

| Ingilizce | Turkce | Ornek |
|-----------|--------|-------|
| in | icinde | in the house |
| on | uzerinde | on the table |
| at | -de/-da | at home |
| to | -e/-a | go to school |
| from | -den/-dan | from Turkey |
| with | ile | with you |
| for | icin | for you |
| about | hakkinda | think about you |

<CultureTip title="Edat Zorlugu" flag="üá¨üáß">
Ingilizce edatlar Turkce'deki hal eklerine karsilik gelir. "I'm in love" (asigim) ve "I'm at home" (evdeyim) gibi ifadeler ezberlenmeli cunku mantiksal bir kural yoktur.
</CultureTip>

## Modal Fiiller

| Modal | Anlam | Ornek |
|-------|-------|-------|
| can | yapabilmek | I can help you |
| could | -ebilirdi | Could you help me? |
| will | -ecek | I will come |
| would | -irdi | Would you like coffee? |
| should | -meli | You should rest |
| must | -meli (zorunlu) | You must go |
| may | -ebilir (izin) | May I kiss you? |
| might | -ebilir (olasilik) | It might rain |

<VocabCard
  word="Can I have a kiss?"
  translation="Opebilir miyim?"
  pronunciation="ken ay hev e kis"
  example="Can I have a kiss before you go?"
/>

## Sifatlar ve Zarflar

### Sifatlar
Isimlerden once gelir:
- a **beautiful** woman (guzel bir kadin)
- a **romantic** dinner (romantik bir aksam yemegi)

### Zarflar
Fiilleri niteler, genellikle **-ly** ile biter:
- She speaks **slowly** (Yavas konusuyor)
- He loves her **deeply** (Onu derinden seviyor)

## Ciftler Icin Pratik

### Diyalog Ornegi

**A**: Do you love me?
**B**: Of course I love you!
**A**: How much?
**B**: More than anything in the world.
**A**: Will you always love me?
**B**: I will always love you, I promise.

### Dilbilgisi Oyunu
Birbirinize tumceler soyleyin ve diger kisi zamanini veya yapisini degistirsin:
- "I love you" ‚Üí "I loved you" ‚Üí "I will love you"
- "She is happy" ‚Üí "Is she happy?" ‚Üí "She isn't happy"

## Ozet Tablosu

| Konu | Turkce | Ingilizce |
|------|--------|-----------|
| Cumle sirasi | Esnek | SVO sabit |
| Zamanlar | Fiil ekleri | Yardimci fiiller |
| Sorular | Tonlama | Yardimci fiil basa |
| Tanim edati | Yok | a/an/the |

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Telaffuz](/learn/tr/en/english-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel ƒ∞ngilizce ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/en/english-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Zor mu?](/learn/tr/en/is-english-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/en/english-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA text="Dilbilgisini birlikte ustalastirinaya hazir misiniz?" buttonText="Simdi Basla" />

articles.title: Spotkanie z wloska rodzina partnera - niezbƒôdne zwroty
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Spotkanie z w≈ÇoskƒÖ rodzinƒÖ to wielkie wydarzenie! W≈Çosi sƒÖ ciepli, rodzinni i... g≈Ço≈õni! Przygotuj siƒô na wylewne powitania, du≈ºo jedzenia i mn√≥stwo pyta≈Ñ.

## Pierwsze spotkanie

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Piacere di conoscervi!"
  translation="Mi≈Ço was poznaƒá!"
  pronunciation="pia-cze-re di ko-no-szer-wi"
  context="Pierwsze powitanie rodziny"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ho sentito molto parlare di voi"
  translation="Du≈ºo o was s≈Çysza≈Çem/am"
  pronunciation="o sen-ti-to mol-to par-la-re di woj"
  example="Piacere! Ho sentito molto parlare di voi."
/>

### Powitania

| W≈Çoski | Wymowa | Polski |
|--------|--------|--------|
| **Buongiorno a tutti!** | bu-on-d≈ºor-no a tu-ti | Dzie≈Ñ dobry wszystkim! |
| **Piacere di conoscerla** | pia-cze-re di ko-no-szer-la | Mi≈Ço PaniƒÖ/Pana poznaƒá (formal.) |
| **Sono felice di essere qui** | so-no fe-li-cze di e-se-re kwi | Cieszƒô siƒô, ≈ºe tu jestem |
| **Grazie per l'invito** | gra-cje per lin-wi-to | Dziƒôkujƒô za zaproszenie |

<CultureTip title="Poca≈Çunki na powitanie" flag="üáÆüáπ">
W≈Çosi witajƒÖ siƒô DWOMA poca≈Çunkami w policzki (zacznij od lewego!). Dotyczy to wszystkich - kobiet, mƒô≈ºczyzn, dzieci! Na pierwszym spotkaniu mo≈ºe byƒá u≈õcisk d≈Çoni, ale potem - gi√†, poca≈Çunki!
</CultureTip>

## Przedstawianie siƒô

<VocabCard
  word="Sono il/la fidanzato/a di..."
  translation="Jestem narzeczonym/narzeczonƒÖ..."
  pronunciation="so-no il fi-dan-ca-to di"
  example="Piacere, sono la fidanzata di Marco."
/>

| W≈Çoski | Wymowa | Polski |
|--------|--------|--------|
| **Mi chiamo...** | mi kia-mo | Nazywam siƒô... |
| **Sono polacco/a** | so-no po-la-ko | Jestem Polakiem/PolkƒÖ |
| **Vengo dalla Polonia** | wen-go da-la po-lo-nia | Jestem z Polski |
| **Lavoro come...** | la-wo-ro ko-me | Pracujƒô jako... |
| **Stiamo insieme da...** | stia-mo in-sie-me da | Jeste≈õmy razem od... |

## Cz≈Çonkowie rodziny

<PhraseOfDay
  word="La famiglia √® tutto"
  translation="Rodzina to wszystko"
  pronunciation="la fa-mi-lia e tu-to"
  context="W≈Çoskie motto rodzinne"
/>
